page.addressleaf:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.
12 J
a
1588
From M
r
Bodley.He is admitted a Counseler
Ja
n
12, 1588
12 Mar
12 Ja
n
88/9
page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. in my last I signified what
course I had taken for
Deventer
and
e rest, and howe
I had sent her
Ma
ties
letter, and also written my self
to
e
Count de Meurs
, to
e Countesse
, and Burgmasters
of
Utrecht:
whiche letters I sent thither by a speciall
gentleman, because
M
r
Gilpin
could hardly be spared.
The Count is not yet returned from
Arnham.
I will
prove to intreat my
L. Willughby
to make a steppe
to Utrecht in person, to
e end her Ma
tie
may be better
satisfied, if it be possible. Uppon her Ma
ties
letters, I am admitted a Counsaillo
r
by
e
Councell of
state
, but not by
e
states g
nr
all
, who require me
first to take
at othe, whiche is contened in
t
heir last
Instruction to
e Councell of state, very prejudiciall
to
e Treaty, and to her Ma
ties
service. About the
debate of this mater, there hath bin often sending too and
fro: but yesterday I had suche c
o
ference w
t
Barnevelt
and others, whome they sent unto me about it, as they
seeme to alter their mindes, and will present me
suche an othe, as shalbe to my liking. The greater par
t
of
e states g
nr
all, and
e whole councell of state
refuse
e Instructions as well as my self, disliking
very muche their proceeding in
e othe. W
t
all the
Councell hath sent certaine committies to
e states g
nr
all
to lett them understand, that unles their autoritie
be preserved, and
e Instructions reformed, they
will no longer sitte in Councell. If I have
touched any thing in my letter to my
L. Treasorer
, wor-
thy
e speaking of againe, I thinke his L will impart
it w
t
yo
r
H
and so I take my humble Leave.
From
e Hage. Ja
n
12. 88
Yo
r
H most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
The answear of
e Burgm
rs
of Utrecht, and of the Countesse,
to whome I directed her Ma
ties
letter, to be conveied to
e Count,
I have sent heer inclosed./
M
r
Killigrew
is determined
to goe towardes
England
to morowe
